comments.title: Shell injection via subprocess with shell=True
comments.body: Using `subprocess.run` with `shell=True` and a user-provided string is vulnerable to shell injection. Use a list of arguments instead.

comments.title: Use of eval() for parsing config
comments.body: Using `eval()` to parse file contents is a critical security vulnerability. It allows arbitrary code execution. Use `json.load()` or `yaml.safe_load()` instead.

comments.title: Hardcoded default API key
comments.body: The default value contains what looks like an API key. Default should be an empty string or None, with proper error handling when the key is missing.

summary: Found critical security issues: eval() usage for config parsing, shell injection risk, and a hardcoded API key default.
